image.altText: albanese dutton split

props.synopsis: The prime minister alleges he was also the subject of a "serious incident," while the AFP has warned the overall number of reported threats to politicians has increased.

title.children: 'There's no place for this': Albanese reaches out to Dutton over report of alleged terror plot

image.altText: Donald Trump sits at a desk and gestures with his hands while speaking.

props.synopsis: US markets plunge again as optimism over President Donald Trump's tariffs "pause" is overshadowed by his escalating trade war with China, which the Whie House says will now be hit with a 145 per cent tariff.

title.children: US markets plunge again as White House confirms China tariff even higher

image.altText: A close up shot of Donald Trump looking at Xi Jinping.

props.synopsis: Of all Trump's miscalculations this week, his biggest miscalculation of all may be assuming that China would not hit back, using the economic power that the Chinese Communist Party has been amassing for decades, but until recently, has not fully deployed.

title.children: Trump assumed the US could dictate a new world order. China said no

image.altText: In vitro fertilisation

props.synopsis: Monash IVF realised the mistake in February, after the birth parents asked to transfer their remaining frozen embryos to another provider.

title.children: Monash IVF mix-up could spark legal battle over child's parentage

image.altText: An ASX board with ASX in focus and stock prices out of focus.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market has continued to slide, down over 1% in the early afternoon, as US tariffs and the escalating trade war with China continue to disrupt global markets. The uncertainty has seen the price of gold hit a new record high. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX falls more than 1pc as gold hits fresh high

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Who sold off US government bonds and was it a rage vote?
Australian share market tracking lower at lunch
Monash IVF shares plummet after baby mix-up

image.altText: A crane vessel and rescue vessel in the river

props.synopsis: Officials say the tour aircraft lost control and hit the water upside down near Lower Manhattan. The bodies have been removed from the water, New York City's Mayor has confirmed.

title.children: Two Siemens executives and their children killed in NY helicopter crash

image.altText: A number of officials pose for a picture next to a grey weapon

props.synopsis: The Defence Department told the ABC that “Australia has not supplied weapons or ammunition to Israel” since the Gaza war began in 2023.

title.children: Australian weapon trialled by Israel's military ahead of potential sale

image.altText: Peter Dutton sitting down with a headset microphone.

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton has claimed former US president Joe Biden initially "didn't want" to strike the AUKUS deal with Australia. Follow live.

title.children: Dutton dodges questions on voluntary redundancy plan for public service cuts

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Dutton's mind turned to 'safety of family' when told of alleged terror plot against him
Dutton won't say if voluntary redundancies will be used to cut public service
Biden's views on 'non-proliferation' behind AUKUS hesitation: Dutton

image.altText: Five people on a beach are shown from behind running into the water as the sun rises.

props.synopsis: A coal industry-funded group campaigning against progressive candidates in the federal election has deleted two months of social media posts after being pulled up by the Australian Electoral Commission over unauthorised content.

title.children: Coal industry-funded group deletes social media posts after AEC intervention

image.altText: Collage of electricity bill behind a green mountain with powerlines on orange background.

props.synopsis: We take a closer look at the average power bill to see which sections Australians should be keeping an eye on or asking questions about.

title.children: Understanding power bills and how consumers are using this to save

image.altText: Woman wearing a hijab crying

props.synopsis: Perimenopause can be a confusing time, so let's get some answers! Follow our live Q&A perimenopause blog as some of the country's best health experts answer your questions.

title.children: Is there any good news about perimenopause? Our experts have some answers

image.altText: Composite of pop star Katy Perry wear oragne outfit with white background, left, with Sydney fashion designer Katie Perry, right

props.synopsis: Sydney fashion designer Katie Perry has secured a hearing in the court after earlier losing an appeal over the use of the homophonous name as a trademark by the US singer.

title.children: Katy Perry v Katie Perry trademark saga to be heard by High Court

image.altText: Annette looks into the camera with a solemn expression, a photo of her deceased son hangs on the wall.

props.synopsis: Australian Super is one of two super funds being sued by ASIC over the handling of death benefit claims. A First Nations family says a deceased family member was mistreated by the fund.

title.children: A super payment went to the wrong account but the fund says it's not to blame

image.altText: Salih

props.synopsis: Palestinian paramedic Salih Muamar was killed by Israeli soldiers in an incident that has sparked international condemnation.  A relative in Australia says he expects no-one will be held to account.

title.children: Australian educator says Israeli probe into relative's killing in Gaza 'means nothing'

image.altText: A close up of Lucy Markovic, wearing her hair in a bob with a middle part and a serious expression on her face

props.synopsis: The model told fans she needed surgery because of an arteriovenous malformation (AVM) "the size of a golf ball".

title.children: Australia's Next Top Model's Lucy Markovic dies aged 27

image.altText: A photo of the Nickel factory sitting by the coast under blue skies.

props.synopsis: A billion-dollar bet on nickel mining gave many New Caledonians hopes of economic prosperity and political independence. But after the market turned, the mine has left behind a ghost town full of broken hearts.

title.children: 'We are in the s**t': Mine's closure cripples Pacific indigenous community

image.altText: Two men wearing suits speak

props.synopsis: Election results trigger, or subsequently lead to, leadership resets. Even in the turmoil of a campaign, players will also have their eyes on the future.

title.children: Will both parties see a leadership change in the next parliament?

image.altText: A soldier is seen partially inside a tank.

props.synopsis: By the time MP Mike Martin described it as "inevitable" last month, conscription was well and truly back in Britain's national conversation, and some people are not against the idea.

title.children: Conscription is 'inevitable' for UK, says MP eyeing war with Russia

image.altText: prince harry speaks to a ukraine soldier at a hospital

props.synopsis: He visited the Superhumans Center in the western Ukraine city of Lviv to meet with wounded soldiers from the ongoing conflict with Russia.

title.children: Prince Harry meets war injured in surprise trip to Ukraine

image.altText: Woman with glasses wearing light pink jumper standing outside in park amid trees

props.synopsis: As the federal election debate builds around Australia's migration numbers and the effect on the housing crisis, members of the Indian diaspora say they are witnessing a growing wave of online racism. At the same time, they watch on as politicians make "performative" gestures to try to win their vote.

title.children: 'You scapegoat me and then you want my vote?': Indian diaspora carries weight of online racism

image.altText: Papers fly in office as Chinese-American woman with long dark hair wearing floral shirt and red vest performs kung fu move.

props.synopsis: Following years of impassioned calls, the Academy Awards will be introducing the Best Stunt Design category at the 100th annual Oscars.

title.children: Oscars add Best Stunt category — here are five films that could have won

image.altText: Donald Trump points angrily on a red carpet, a largue statue of an Oscar behind him.

props.synopsis: Plus, Cannes Film Festival slate announced and how to watch Lady Gaga's Coachella set.

title.children: Why China's hit against Hollywood should have Trump worried

image.altText: People walking on a footpath with arches of a 19th century stone building

props.synopsis: Four Adelaide city councillors have lost their positions, and voters will need to re-cast ballots, after a judge found results in one of the wards during the November 2022 elections were affected by "illegal practices".

title.children: Adelaide council ward election result declared void after 'illegal practices'

image.altText: An Aboriginal woman, wearing a patterned head scarf, navy blue top sitting in a bushland area.

props.synopsis: The Coalition will be hoping to win the Northern Territory seat of Lingiari for the first time this federal election, as a battle ensues to win over disillusioned voters in the bush.

title.children: Battle to win electorate with Australia's least engaged voters

image.altText: A woman and a toddler sit on a floor playing with toys

props.synopsis: More than 77 per cent of households in the south-east Queensland electorate of Blair are feeling some form of financial stress — and as the federal election nears, it's a problem playing out across the country.

title.children: If you map financial stress, you'll find these 'aspirational Australians'

image.altText: A woman in a pick top stands in front of a man wearing a blue suit with a map graphic behind them.

props.synopsis: With a 0.2 per cent margin, high-profile candidates expect preferences to again decide the winner in Gilmore as Labor's Fiona Phillips faces former NSW Liberal minister Andrew Constance.

title.children: Disrupter enters fray in battle for ultra-marginal NSW seat

image.altText: Fossil jawbone as seen from the right.

props.synopsis: An analysis of a jawbone found off the Taiwanese coast reveals it belonged to a Denisovan, a mysterious human species that contributed some genetic material to Indigenous Australians and people living in Asia today.

title.children: Enigmatic extinct cousin of modern humans confirmed in Taiwan

image.altText: Annie Liston standing infront of her sisters house in Adavale.

props.synopsis: Thick layers of silt now stick to belongings like tar and furniture is strewn across the street in a small community in south-west Queensland.

title.children: Outback residents contemplate relocating flood-ravaged town

image.altText: Pacific oyster

props.synopsis: A review into the deaths of 70 per cent of South Australia's oyster spat has not unearthed any clues.

title.children: Cause of oyster spat deaths at research facility remains a mystery

image.altText: A woman takes a photograph of illuminated cherry blossoms in full bloom

props.synopsis: The Australian dollar has been tracking lower against all major currencies, making overseas travel more expensive in popular tourist destinations.

title.children: $25 for a glass of wine: Why you may want to rethink overseas plans

image.altText: Dressed in bright red leotards, a group of people hang from a rope suspended in the air. They flex their muscles.

props.synopsis: For more than 40 years, Circus Oz has been entertaining and terrifying audiences. Its latest show, Non Stop, does both while proving age is no barrier to being in the circus.

title.children: A 65-year-old circus artist performs a 'dive of death' in new MICF show

image.altText: a genetically modified 'dire wolf' puppy

props.synopsis: Test yourself with this week's quiz.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: Doctors walk off, the Coalition walks back, and a pop star is heading Down Under
